省.definition: (bound form) to scrutinize; (bound form) to reflect (on one's conduct); (bound form) to come to realize; (bound form) to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)

省事.definition: perceptive; understanding; (archaic) to handle administrative work

省力.definition: to save labor; to save effort

省勁.definition: to save labor; to save effort

省勁兒.definition: erhua variant of 省勁|省劲[sheng3 jin4]

省卻.definition: to save; to get rid of (so saving space)

省去.definition: to omit; to dispense with; to make unnecesary; to save (time, trouble etc)

省察.definition: to examine; to cast a critical eye over (especially in the context of introspection)

省得.definition: to avoid; so as to save (money or time)

省心.definition: to cause no trouble; to be spared worry; worry-free

省悟.definition: to wake up to reality; to come to oneself; to realize; to see the truth

省油的燈.definition: sb who is easy to deal with

省流.definition: to conserve mobile data; to minimize mobile data usage (abbr. for 省流量[sheng3 liu2 liang4])

省港澳.definition: abbr. for the economic region of Guangdong Province (or Guangzhou), Hong Kong and Macao

省直管縣.definition: direct management of a county by the province (PRC administrative reform)

省省吧.definition: (coll.) Don't waste your breath.; Save it!
